frameDefinitions: These adjectives describe the degree of strictness or tolerance of an Agent, usually with regard to another person (the Controllee) and often with regard to a particular Issue.
An Executive_authority exercises their power to reduce or remove negative consequences for someone who has been labeled an Offender who participated in an Crime.
A Controlling_entity has control of a Dependent_entity, Dependent_situation, or Dependent_variable.

A Suspect in a Current_jurisdiction is forced by Authorities (of the Current_jurisdiction) to go to the Crime_jurisdiction, i.e. the jurisdiction which requested that the Suspect be handed over for trial for a crime which he or she is suspected to have committed in the Crime_jurisdiction.
An Executioner punishes an individual (Executed) with death as a consequence of some action of the Evaluee (the Reason).
The words of this frame describe how a Resource_controller spends money or other Resources for a particular purpose .
frameExamples: Court says judge too <t>lenient</t> in rape case.INI

A Fort Worth man convicted of a robbery his brother later confessed
to committing was granted <t>clemency</t> on December 20, 2002, by Governor Rick Perry.
She was in <t>control</t> of the empire within two days.
The fraud was <t>extradited</t> from Venezuela to the US.
listRoleDefinitions: The Agent is the person who is strict or liberal in his/her control over another. This role is usually the External Argument with predicate adjectives, or the head noun if the adjective is used attributively: <fex name='Agent'>The school</fex> is very <t>liberal</t> in approach and curriculum. I attended a very <t>liberal</t> <fex name='Agent'>school</fex>.

The Agent's strictness may be directed towards or limited to some particular person or group over whom he/she has control.  The Controlled_entity generally occurs in a PP Complement.
Grandparents are often <t>indulgent</t> <fex name='Controlled_entity'>with their grandchildren</fex>.
The Agent's strictness may be manifested in particular behavior: The judge was <t>lenient</t> <fex name='Controlling_act'>in dealing with the offender</fex>.

The Agent may be strict or lenient with respect to a particular matter or situation.  Issue occurs in PP Complements, usually headed by <ment>about</ment>: The city council is <t>strict</t> <fex name='Issue'>about pollution control</fex>.

A Medium of control, such as rules, may also be described as strict or lenient.  Medium may occur with or without the Agent who ultimately has control (i.e. the one who implements or enforces the rules). The club has <t>strict</t> <fex name='Medium'>rules</fex> about who can become a member. <fex name='Medium'>Immigration law</fex> is very <t>strict</t>.
The body part or expression of the <fen>Agent</fen> that indicates their strictness.
The individual who is accused or convicted of a <fen>Crime</fen>.
An action deemed criminal by law.
The constitutionally specified authority who has the power to grant clemency.
The time at which clemency is granted.
The location at which the <fen>Executive_authority</fen> grants clemency.
A thing or person whose behavior controls a <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>, <fen>Dependent_situation</fen>, or <fen>Dependent_variable</fen>.
An entity, usually a thing, that is influenced in its behavior by a <fen>Controlling_entity</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the controlling occurs.
The location at which the controlling occurs.
The <fen>Authorities</fen> act on behalf of the <fen>Current_jurisdiction</fen>, giving up the <fen>Suspect</fen> to the Crime_jurisdiction.
The jurisdiction (generally a nation) the <fen>Suspect</fen> starts off in.
The jurisdiction (generally a nation) to which the <fen>Suspect</fen> is sent.
The Suspect is forced to go to the jurisdiction where a crime he or she is suspected of took place or is being tried.
The time at which  the <fen>Suspect</fen> is moved.
The location where the extradition occurs.
The <fen>Executioner</fen> is the individual who performs the execution.
The <fen>Executed</fen> is the person who is killed by the <fen>Executioner</fen> in retribution for the crime that the <fen>Executed</fen> was convicted of.
When the execution occurs.
Where the execution takes place.

The <fen>Resource_controller</fen> is the individual whose frugality or generosity is being described. Person typically occurs as the External Argument or, in some cases when <fen>Behavior</fen> is also expressed, in an <ment>of</ment>-PP:
Some specific <fen>Behavior</fen> may be described as frugal or extravagant, rather than attributing the characteristic directly to the <fen>Resource_controller</fen>.
This role is the resource which the <fen>Resource_controller</fen> expends.
listRoleExamples: I like to think he quaked under my authoritarian <fex>glare</fex>.

Since 1976, <fex>225 death row inmates</fex> have been granted clemency for humanitarian
reasons.
I never saw a legal case where a person was given clemency <fex>for murder</fex>.
Mr. Papa was granted clemency for a drug conviction <fex>by Mr. Pataki</fex>, and released in 1997

In addition to Ms.  White, 55, Mr.  Pataki granted clemency <fex>yesterday</fex> to three men serving long prison terms for offenses under the stern Rockefeller-era drug laws that mandate long sentences for some relatively low-level drug crimes.
Apparently, no woman has ever been granted clemency <fex>there</fex>.
<fex>French officials</fex> extradited him back to Canada.
Jones was extradited <fex>from Mexico</fex> last Thursday to face criminal charges in the United States.
It was the third time a neo-Nazi was extradited from Denmark <fex>to Germany</fex>.
A hearing on whether or not to extradite <fex>Johnson</fex> to Isreal will be held tomorrow.
<fex>In Europe</fex> they extradite more freely than in North America.
The truth is, <fex>we</fex> have all put them to death.
<fex>He</fex> was to be hanged in the morning.
It's thrifty of Jo <fex>to re-use teabags</fex>.
